Posts.Content: Mar 2, 2012 06:11PM sandik wrote: Hi Indigo, Sorry you had to join us. The waiting is awful. Like you, I was better after I got the call than before. Not that I didn't break down a few times, but the not knowing is bad! My surgery is scheduled for the 13 the. Funny you say about the nook. I bought a Droid tablet. Haha Instead of an email, I made a group on Facebook, added all of my friends that I want to keep updated. After every step, I write a post and they all know what's going on. They also have been posting lots of motivational stuff for me on there.
Posts.Title: The now official diagnosis IndigoMont11 Iz_and_Lys_Mum

Posts.Content: sandik wrote: I'm 40 yrs old. Just had my first mammogram on Thursday. She saw something that concerned her, so she ran more tests. Then I was sent into another room where they did an ultrasound. A Dr came in to re-run the ultrasound again and to tell me that I need a biopsy. I am scheduled for 9:30 tomorrow morning. I've since gotten my report from the lab in today's,mail. The mammogram report is saying irregular mass with distortion of regional breast tissue. Findings are highly suspicious for malignancy. Spot magnification compression view shows 6.0x3.9 cm mass with spiculated margins. No calcifications. Bi-rads is 0. But then the ulteasound report says this...upper outer quadrant at 3:00 there is a 1.9x1.0x2.0cm hypoechoic mass with irregular margins. No significant vascularity on color Doppler imaging. Findings are suspicious for malignancy. Ultrasound guided biopsy recommended. Size discrepancy between mammogram and ultrasound is likely related to architectural distortion I regional breast parenchyma on mammogram. Bi.-ads -4 So so scared. Don't really know what to do. Scared!! Dx 2/17/2012, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 3/13/2012 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left, Sentinel Surgery 4/2/2012 Lumpectomy: Left Chemotherapy 4/25/2012 AC Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: scared!!! sandik marie5890

He was great and I barely felt anything at all!  He said the ultrasound shows the true size, so it really is only 2cm. He said I should know by Thursday. Fingers crossed!

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2012 10:58AM sandik wrote: Thanks ladies. I just talked to my fater's brother. He confirmed that his mother did in fact have breast cancer. Twice. First time they found it was in her 60s (this would have been in the 70s). She had the lump removed. Did not need chemo or radiation. She just took pills. Another 4 years went by and she found the other one, on the other breast. She had that one removed. Again no chemo or radiation. Just pills. She had a double masectomy. Not sure if each one came off as she got the tumors removed or if she did it after the second one. She lived another 20 years after that.  I know not everyone's is the same, and mine probaby won't be like hers. But, it makes me feel a little bit better I think.   I head up a group of women who have been doing Girl's Night Out fundraisers. We donate the money to a local organization that helps children with cancer. I contacted the woman in charge of that organization to ask her some names of some good oncologists in the area.
Posts.Title: scared!!! sandik marie5890

Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2012 07:22PM sandik wrote: Thanks guys! Over the last 2 weeks I've been pretty ok. Had a few meltdowns. My daughter has been really quiet. Tonight I cornered her and asked her what was up. She's scared. She's 18. She's scared of what will happen to me and scared that it will happen to her as well.  Other than that, they are still trying to get me an appt for a PET scan. They are also trying to get me an appt with the oncologist who has been sick, so is now backed up. :/ I pick up all of my films and test reports tomorrow morning so I have them to give to the surgeon when I meet him on Thursday.

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2012 07:52AM sandik wrote: The Dr that did the biopsy said he will call my family Dr tomorrow to discuss where I am going to go. As long as my Dr is open tomorrow, that is. He said he would call me tomorrow. He gave me his cell and told me I can call him direct any time I want. He did suggest 1 Dr. He's the same one who did my sister's biopsy (B9), and she really liked him,  and my friend's hubby who is an OBGYN said he is really good. So, I feel pretty comfortable going with him.  How long are you down after that surgery?
Posts.Title: scared!!! sandik marie5890

Posts.Content: Nov 21, 2012 11:14AM sandik wrote: Just wanted to come back and follow this up. I did my lumpectomy in March. Had to go back in for cleaner margins in April. Started chemo in May, finished in September. I started radiation Oct 1 and finished today!! I am officially finished with treatment. I had a pet scan in oct. No evidence of disease. I am cancer free, my hair is growing back in, and I am going to have an awesome Thanksgiving! I did end up with LE, but it is pretty much under control right now. I get fitted for a sleeve next week.  But, I wanted to say thank you to all the women who have come before me, who held my hand and showed me that I didn't have to be so scared and that I was not alone.  Have a great Thanksgiving!
Posts.Title: scared!!! sandik marie5890

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2012 09:27AM sandik wrote: I was told to use baby oil on the tape to loosen it. I use alchohol on my arm to help the tape stick. I loosly wrap medical tape around the ends, just so they don't start peeling/rolling down in a few hours. I use the tape right up into my fingers, so it usually rolls pretty quickly after applying it.

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2012 10:38PM sandik wrote: Oh my! I would not be happy. Mine is moving really quick compared to others. I had my mammogram on Thursday, the ultrasound immediately after, then a biopsy yesterday. The Dr said he would call me tomorrow with the results. I cannot stop thinking about it. Maybe they didn't get enough tissue to test? My Dr was explaining the whole thing to me as he went. He said they like 2 or 3 samples but he always gives 4 so they are sure to have enough. I hope your time moves quickly for you.

Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2012 07:22AM sandik wrote: Crap! I never thought about deductibles for rads either. I've got $100 for every chemo session. $50 for the actual chemo and then $50 for the shot the next day. That wasn't too bad on dd, but taxol will be weekly. $400 a month. Ugh. If I can't keep working throughout, Im screwed. Going to call rads today to see if I can find anything out.
Posts.Title: Summer 2012 RADS HANG OUT Stacie rgina

Posts.Title: Summer 2012 RADS HANG OUT Stacie rgina

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2012 02:49PM sandik wrote: My radiologist told me at the time of the biopsy that he calls, either way. He called me at 5:30 in Friday to tell me it was cancer. He talked for a little while, asked if I had someone there with me and gave me his cell phone number. He told me to call if I have any questions at all. I spent the weekend reading and learning, then called him Monday morning. He stayed on the phone with me for about 40 minutes answering every question I threw at him.
Posts.Title: How did you hear biopsy results--phone or appt? frazzledmom schoolmom

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2012 11:20AM sandik wrote: I just found out Friday that I have cancer. Like you, I am waiting to meet with my surgeon. In my head, I am imagining all kinds of things. I am blaming myself. How can this be growing inside me and I didn't know! My periods have been messed up for a year now, due to a thyroid problem. Or was it part of this??!! I just want it out! I keep reading on here. It terrifies me but reassures me at the same time. I can't explain it.  Seabeal, we will get through this together!
Posts.Title: What's next? seabeal sandik

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2012 09:44PM sandik wrote: We just moved into a studio from a home studio. So, now I have to worry about overhead (rent, electric etc) so I have those worries. Will I be able to shoot? We've put a hold on taking on weddings for now. Regular portraits can be rescheduled if Im not feeling well or need treatment. Weddings can't.  Thank you hillck and ysa! I was a mess most of today. Got some calls from family members who found out, so each time was a crying mess. haha But, tomorrow is a new day. Hopefully I will have something to keep me busy for most of it. I'm supposed to get a call from the dr who did my biopsy to discuss the next steps. Maybe once I start getting a plan together I won't feel so much like Im spinning my wheels.   Thank you dragonfly for the book reccomendation. I will have to look into it.

Posts.Title: Summer 2012 RADS HANG OUT Stacie rgina

Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2012 12:13PM sandik wrote: Just got off the phone with the insurance company. I DO have to pay a co-pay every time I go for radiation. I think he said Id be 7 weeks of radiation. That's $1750. My husband called back to talk to someone else and got the same answer. Our deductible is $9000, we are at $5000 right now, but co-pays do not count. SOOO glad this came up. I never would have thought about that and I would have been screwed.  We are doing a withdrawl from our 401k, but can only do it once, so if I did it before this it would not have been good!

Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2012 04:11AM sandik wrote: My lump was deep in the breast and mine was exactly as Blessings said. My radiologist was training someone, so he was explaining it as he went along. I think that helped. I did not look at any needles (I HATE needles) I just listened to him explain it all.  Throughout my biopsy and my lumpectomy I did ice ice ice. Never had any problems with being in pain or huge amounts of swelling or anything. Ice helped more than tylenol.
